item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2786) to reauthorize the programs for housing assistance for Native Americans.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 633, H. Res. 613 is laid on the table.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 104.
Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-298, by Mr. McGovern.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-298, by Mr. McGovern.

summary.text: Makes it in order at any time on August 4, 2007, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules relating to a bill to: (1) authorize additional funds for emergency repairs and reconstruction of the Interstate I-35 bridge located in Minneapolis, Minnesota, that collapsed on August 1, 2007; and (2) amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to establish a procedure for authorizing certain electronic surveillance .

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Makes it in order at any time on August 4, 2007, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules relating to a bill to: (1) authorize additional funds for emergency repairs and reconstruction of the Interstate I-35 bridge located in Minneapolis, Minnesota, that collapsed on August 1, 2007; and (2) amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to establish a procedure for authorizing certain electronic surveillance .

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
